intro: Jacquinia arborea, commonly known as the tree heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially sunny environments. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Jacquinia arborea is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
